page.title: 15CORBRIDGE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
page.content: Corbridge Women's Institute meets on the first Monday evening every month. Approximately 45 members arrive by car and on foot and converge on the 65 year old wooden hut with cloakroom and kitchen facilities,situated on Stagshaw Road.Meetings are run formally,opening with the singing of "Jerusalem" and the Presidents welcome.Full minutes are read before formal business conducted through the chair.Outings and events are organised,correspondence,reports, and County and National magazines are circulated,before the introduction of a speaker.Questions and formal thanks follow.A members rota provides tea and biscuits to allow casual mingling and discussions or games may follow.Two monthly competitions are judged for points towards an annual competition, and a raffle is drawn at each meeting.
